original: Hössjer, Karl Gustav Natanael, professor, rektor, Göteborg, f. 16/1/97 i Slätthög, Kronob. 1. G. 22 m. fil. mag, Ingeborg Rosengren. Barn: Karl f. 23, fil. stud.. Lund, Inga 28, Lena 38. — Fil. mag. i Lund 16, fil. lic. 19 o. fil. dr 29. E. o. lektor i Landskrona 22-29, lektor v. Malmö flicklärov. 30, docent i mateni. v. Lunds univ. 29-36, ett flert. prof :förordn., prof. i matem. v. CTH sed. 36, prorektor där 40 o. rektor sed. 43. Censor i studiex. 36-42, led. av styr. f. Sv. textilforskn :inst. sied. 44. Skr.: über ein Riemiannsches Problem I-II m. fl. RNO, LV\^S.
translated: Hössjer, Karl Gustav Natanael was a professor and rector in Gothenburg. He was born on January 16, 1897 in Slätthög, Kronoburg. He was married to Ingeborg Rosengren and they had three children: Karl, born in 1923 and studying philosophy in Lund, Inga, born in 1928, and Lena, born in 1938. He received his Bachelor's degree in Lund in 1916, his Master's degree in 1919, and his Doctorate in 1929. He was a substitute teacher in Landskrona from 1922 until 1929, a teacher at Malmö girls' school in 1930, an associate professor of mathematics at Lund University from 1929 to 1936, and held several professorships. He was a mathematics professor at Chalmers University of Technology from 1936 and prorector from 1940 to 1943 when he became rector. He was a censor for the Swedish school-leaving exam from 1936 to 1942 and a member of the board of the Swedish Textile Research Institute since 1944. He wrote about a Riemannian problem in several publications and was an RNO and LV'S.

structured.name: Karl Gustav Natanael Hössjer
structured.description: Karl Gustav Natanael Hössjer (1897-01-16 to ????) was a Swedish mathematician. He was a professor and rector at the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden. He wrote several publications about a Riemannian problem.
